semantic_title: Admission/Encounter for Treatment of Secondary Neoplasm Site
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > b. Admission/Encounter for treatment of secondary site

content.full_text: When a patient is admitted because of a primary neoplasm with metastasis and treatment is directed toward the secondary site only, the secondary neoplasm is designated as the principal diagnosis even though the primary malignancy is still present. (Evidence: pg no: 34, L21-L26)
content.summary: Guidelines for sequencing secondary neoplasm as principal diagnosis when treatment is directed only at metastatic site (Evidence: pg no: 34, L21-L26)
key_concepts: Secondary neoplasm as principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L25)
Treatment directed toward secondary site only (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L23)
Primary malignancy still present but not treated (Evidence: pg no: 34, L25-L26)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Secondary neoplasm is designated as principal diagnosis when treatment is directed toward secondary site only (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L25)
detailed_rules.explanation: Even though the primary malignancy is still present, if treatment is only directed at the metastatic site, the secondary neoplasm takes precedence as principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L26)
common_applications: Patient with lung cancer metastatic to brain, admitted for brain tumor resection
Patient with breast cancer metastatic to bone, admitted for bone lesion treatment

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify primary neoplasm with metastasis
Step 2: Determine if treatment is directed only toward secondary site
Step 3: Assign secondary neoplasm as principal diagnosis
Step 4: Code primary malignancy as secondary diagnosis

code_ranges.description: Secondary malignant neoplasm codes (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L25)
code_ranges.requirement: Use as principal when treatment directed at secondary site only
usage_rules: Sequence as principal diagnosis when treatment is for secondary site only (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L25)

references_to.title: Admission/Encounter for treatment of primary site
references_to.explanation: Contrasts with primary site treatment guidelines

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with primary lung cancer metastatic to brain, admitted for brain tumor resection only
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient with known lung adenocarcinoma with brain metastasis, admitted for craniotomy and resection of brain lesion
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify that treatment is directed only at brain metastasis
Step 2: Assign brain metastasis code as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Assign lung cancer code as secondary diagnosis

secondary_codes: C78.00 (Secondary malignant neoplasm of unspecified lung)
correct_coding.sequencing: Secondary neoplasm first, primary neoplasm second
correct_coding.rationale: Treatment is directed only toward the secondary site (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L25)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Primary lung cancer code should not be principal when treatment is only for brain metastasis
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Sequencing primary neoplasm first when treatment is only for secondary site

warnings: Primary malignancy may still be present but is not the focus of treatment (Evidence: pg no: 34, L25-L26)
best_practices: Carefully review documentation to determine which site is being treated (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L23)
common_mistakes: Always sequencing primary neoplasm first regardless of treatment focus (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L25)
tips: Focus on where treatment is directed, not which cancer came first (Evidence: pg no: 34, L22-L25)
implementation_notes: This guideline applies even when primary malignancy is still present
clinical_context: Common in oncology when metastatic disease requires immediate intervention
